news.headline: Ladder Capital Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
news.article_text:
Ladder Capital NYSE: LADR executives used the company’s fourth-quarter 2025 earnings call to highlight a year they characterized as a turning point, marked by the attainment of investment-grade credit ratings and a renewed emphasis on growing the loan portfolio and earnings in 2026.

news.headline: IREN's Q2 Loss Wider Than Expected, Revenues Decline Q/Q
news.article_text:
IREN Limited’s IREN second-quarter fiscal 2026 loss of 44 cents per share came in wider than the Zacks Consensus Estimate pegged at a loss of 9 cents per share. The company reported earnings of 9 cents per share in the year-ago quarter.



IREN reported a net loss of $155.4 million against a net income of $384.6 million in the previous quarter.



Total revenues decreased 23.1% sequentially to $184.7 million, missing the consensus estimate by 16.49%.



IREN’s shares have gained 5.4% year to dat

Both actions point to a shift in how the company is balancing its capital structure and shareholder returns.

news.headline: Moody’s Expands Risk Tools As Private Credit Scrutiny And Valuation Questions Grow
news.article_text:
Get insights on thousands of stocks from the global community of over 7 million individual investors at Simply Wall St.

Moody's (NYSE:MCO) recently acquired Numerated Growth Technologies to expand its lending technology capabilities.

The company also acquired CAPE Analytics, adding advanced property and insurance risk modeling tools to its platform.

These deals come as the private credit market, now around $2tn in size, faces increased regulatory scrutiny.

news.headline: Stock Market Survives AI Panic, Even as Tech Collapses. It’s a Monster of Our Own Making.
news.summary: A sharp selloff in software and data analytics stocks reveals growing fears that AI tools could cannibalize established industries.

news.headline: AI Fears Slam Booking and Expedia Stock. Why They Can Bounce Back.
news.summary: Online travel agencies, or OTAs, like Priceline owner  Booking.com  and  Expedia  have been hit hard, with their shares both down around 13% this week.  After all, it’s not the first time that AI fears have clobbered the stocks, and they’ve always rebounded, as travel demand remains robust.  Baird analyst Michael Bellisario added both companies to his firm’s fresh bullish picks on Friday, reiterating Outperform ratings on both.

news.headline: Down 18.4% in 4 Weeks, Here's Why You Should You Buy the Dip in Booking Holdings (BKNG)
news.article_text:
Booking Holdings (BKNG) has been on a downward spiral lately with significant selling pressure. After declining 18.4% over the past four weeks, the stock looks well positioned for a trend reversal as it is now in oversold territory and there is strong agreement among Wall Street analysts that the company will report better earnings than they predicted earlier.

We use Relative Strength Index (RSI), one of the most commonly used technical indicators, for spotting whether a stock is oversold. This

news.article_text:
We came across a bullish thesis on Booking Holdings Inc. on Nikhs’s Substack. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on BKNG. Booking Holdings Inc.'s share was trading at $5,085.22 as of January 28th. BKNG’s trailing and forward P/E were 33.54 and 19.12, respectively according to Yahoo Finance.

news.headline: Booking Holdings Refocuses KAYAK Leadership As AI Becomes Core To Travel
news.article_text:
Track your investments for FREE with Simply Wall St, the portfolio command center trusted by over 7 million individual investors worldwide.

Booking Holdings (NasdaqGS:BKNG) announced a leadership change at KAYAK, with Co Founder and long time CEO Steve Hafner stepping down.

Peer Bueller has been appointed as the new CEO of KAYAK, taking over operational leadership of the metasearch brand.
